text:
Okay great! Thanks for sending this all through. I’ve definitely got some pointers but I also have some more questions!

Where do you see yourself in two, five and ten years time? It’s a lame question I know but it helps me understand your aims.

And why nuke? Is it film compositing you want to get into? Because you seem to have some great tv/commercial/motion graphic type work. I used to do motion graphics and online editing for tv commercials and I made the jump to nuke so I can understand if that’s what you want to do.
Btw I apologise if I’m a bit slow replying at the moment, work is quite busy at the moment. But I’ll always try and respond ASAP!

I want to work for film. So I’m interested in companies such as framestore, mpc and double negative. I plan to apply after September when I sort out my final project and I have a stronger portfolio. I want to work in the industry for three years and then go into teaching in universities.
In my spare time I want to work on short films and send them to festivals
I see myself moving around for three years and then settling down

I do want to make the jump into compositing. It is something that interests me. I think that would make the full circle for me. In terms of career goals. I want to work in compositing (that is what I want to specialize)

So any pointers and directions would be nice. Also references. Since I’m working on my dissertation I want to polish my work and make the dissertation reflect the time I am investing in research and practice. Any advice of my portfolio or the topic I am going into it would be greatly appreciated. And I know you are busy so don’t apologize. I really appreciate your time. Thank you
